content:
• Tuesday, April 17, 2012
  • STX

    In its conference call, Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) guides Q4 revenue  higher, now...

    In its conference call, Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) guides Q4 revenue  higher, now expecting to earn upwards of $5B, above Street estimates of $4.94B. Adjusted gross margin will exceed 34.5%. The company says the desktop drive market will remain constrained through the fall, while the enterprise and mission-critical market segments seem to have almost fully recovered. Shares +3.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 PM
  • TNP

    Oil shipper Tsakos Energy Navigation (NYSE:TNP) announces a 10M share secondary offering....

    Oil shipper Tsakos Energy Navigation (NYSE:TNP) announces a 10M share secondary offering. Entities affiliated with the Tsakos Foundation, the company's largest shareholder, plan to purchase approximately 10% of the shares sold in the offering. Shares -7.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 PM
  • STX

    More on Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX): FQ3 blows away consensus estimates on a surge in...

    More on Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX): FQ3 blows away consensus estimates on a surge in revenue. Earnings soared over 65% Y/Y, after emerging from last year's flooding disaster in Thailand relatively unscathed. Going forward, the company says it expects demand to continue outstripping supply for all of 2012 and likely some of 2013, which should keep prices up. Shares +3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM
  • IN

    Intermec (NYSE:IN) -19.4% AH after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $180M and EPS of -$0.24,...

    Intermec (NYSE:IN) -19.4% AH after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $180M and EPS of -$0.24, well below a consensus of $207.1M and $0.04. The company blames weaker-than-expected demand in Europe. In addition, Intermec says it's evaluating its deferred tax asset and goodwill balances, and its evaluation could lead to a Q1 loss even worse than its revised guidance. It looks as if Raymond James had bad timing.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM
  • AMD

    During its Q1 earnings call (live blog), Intel attributes the decline seen in PC CPU sales (even...

    During its Q1 earnings call (live blog), Intel attributes the decline seen in PC CPU sales (even as PC shipments rose) on inventory cuts caused by hard drive shortages. It predicts inventory replenishment will begin in Q2 and accelerate in Q3, aided by the Ivy Bridge launch. The chip giant adds it's seeing some low-end price competition, presumably from AMD - that could explain Intel's slightly soft Q2 gross margin guidance. INTC -2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for 2012 sales growth...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for 2012 sales growth of 19%-21%, above a consensus of 18.5% and the company's prior guidance range of 17%-19%. Da Vinci robot procedures are now expected to increase 25%-27% from 2011 levels, compared with prior guidance of 24%-26%. ISRG +5.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • URI

    More on United Rentals (NYSE:URI): Q1 EPS blows out estimates, swinging to a profit on the...

    More on United Rentals (NYSE:URI): Q1 EPS blows out estimates, swinging to a profit on the quarter as rental volumes and rates continue to improve despite a weak construction market. Revenue jumped 25% Y/Y as margins were strengthened by a surge in equipment demand, as increasingly more construction and industrial companies opt to rent rather than own heavy equipment. Shares +8.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • DELL

    More on IBM's Q1: Services backlog stood at $139B, down from $141B at end of Q4. Services...

    More on IBM's Q1: Services backlog stood at $139B, down from $141B at end of Q4. Services revenue +1% Y/Y (+3% in Q4). Hardware -7% (-8% in Q4), hurt by 25% drop for mainframes and 4% drop for storage (share loss to EMC?). Software +5% (+9% in Q4), affected by slowing growth for middleware and Tivoli. Total analytics revenue +14% Y/Y. Americas and Asia-Pac revenue up slightly, Europe -2%. Gross margin rose 120 bps Y/Y to 45.7% (helps explain EPS beat). IBM -1.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 4 Comments
  • INTC

    More on Intel's Q1: Gross margin of 65.1% exceeds guidance of 64%. However, company expects GM...

    More on Intel's Q1: Gross margin of 65.1% exceeds guidance of 64%. However, company expects GM to decline to 63% in Q2, and is leaving 2012 guidance unchanged at 65%. Capex and opex forecasts also unchanged. PC CPU division sales fell 2% Y/Y, a reversal from Q4's 17% gain. Server CPU division sales fell marginally after rising 8% in Q1 (Romley timing likely played a role). INTC -2.5% AH. (PR) (CFO comments - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • CSX

    CSX (NYSE:CSX): Q1 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $3B (+6% Y/Y) beats by $70M. Shares...

    CSX (NYSE:CSX): Q1 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $3B (+6% Y/Y) beats by $70M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • CREE

    More on Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ3 misses across-the-board on declining revenue. Adjusted net...

    More on Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ3 misses across-the-board on declining revenue. Adjusted net income declined 50% Y/Y, despite being offset by better cost controls and a large tax benefit. The company also warns for FQ4, now seeing its EPS coming in around $0.20 - $0.26 per share on revenue between $295M - $315M. Street estimates were for an EPS of $0.28 on revenue of $323M. Shares -6.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • URI

    United Rentals (NYSE:URI): Q1 EPS of $0.36 beats by $0.30. Revenue of $656M (+25.4% Y/Y) beats...

    United Rentals (NYSE:URI): Q1 EPS of $0.36 beats by $0.30. Revenue of $656M (+25.4% Y/Y) beats by $45M. Shares +6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q1 EPS of $3.50 beats by $0.35. Revenue of $495M (+27.6% Y/Y)...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q1 EPS of $3.50 beats by $0.35. Revenue of $495M (+27.6% Y/Y) beats by $30M. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • IBM

    IBM (NYSE:IBM): Q1 EPS of $2.78 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $24.67B (flat Y/Y) misses by $100M....

    IBM (NYSE:IBM): Q1 EPS of $2.78 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $24.67B (flat Y/Y) misses by $100M. Company expects 2012 EPS of $15, above consensus of $14.93 and prior guidance of $14.85. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.07. Revenue (ex-TAC) of $1.08B (+1% Y/Y) beats by...

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.07. Revenue (ex-TAC) of $1.08B (+1% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Sees Q2 sales (ex-TAC) of $1.03B-$1.14B. Shares +2.6% AH. Conference call scheduled for 5:00 PM Eastern. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • STX

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX): FQ3 EPS of $2.64 beats by $0.54. Revenue of $4.45B (+65% Y/Y)...

    Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX): FQ3 EPS of $2.64 beats by $0.54. Revenue of $4.45B (+65% Y/Y) beats by $70M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q1 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $12.91B (flat Y/Y) beats by...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q1 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $12.91B (flat Y/Y) beats by $70M. Company expects Q2 revenue of $13.1B-$14.1B vs. consensus of $13.4B. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 5 Comments
  • CREE

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ3 EPS of $0.20 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $284M (+30% Y/Y) misses by...

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ3 EPS of $0.20 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $284M (+30% Y/Y) misses by $16M. Shares -8.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • C

    Helping Citigroup (C +3.2%) rally today is an upgrade to Hold from long-time critic Meredith...

    Helping Citigroup (C +3.2%) rally today is an upgrade to Hold from long-time critic Meredith Whitney. Whitney praises Citi's improving operating metrics and low valuation, and says she's impressed with the rebound in the bank's equity trading and FICC ops demonstrated by its Q1 report. “She’s starting to sound a little like Dick Bove," quips Pete Najarian. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro (AMD +3.3%) gains after Sterne Agee ups its price target to $10 from $8. The firm...

    Advanced Micro (AMD +3.3%) gains after Sterne Agee ups its price target to $10 from $8. The firm says AMD has gained share in graphics, and raises its estimates for the company's March and June quarters above consensus levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • ECYT

    Endocyte (ECYT +9.7%) extends a second day of gains after RBC Capital raised its price target to...

    Endocyte (ECYT +9.7%) extends a second day of gains after RBC Capital raised its price target to $12 from $8 earlier today, saying it continues to view the stock as a "compelling investment." RBC sees several upcoming catalysts for the stock, including the resumption of Doxil supply in Q4 and an agreement with the FDA on a Phase III statistical plan in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -0.9%) isn't taking part in today's rally. MasterCard's daily deals announcement...

    Groupon (GRPN -0.9%) isn't taking part in today's rally. MasterCard's daily deals announcement could be playing a role, as might a bearish note from Ascendiant Capital. The firm, which rates Groupon a Sell, lowered its PT to $11 from $14 on a belief the company's Q4 restatement will increase opex and uncertainty.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings-owned (SHLD +0.1%) Sears Canada (SEARF.PK) plans to focus on appliance and tool...

    Sears Holdings-owned (SHLD +0.1%) Sears Canada (SEARF.PK) plans to focus on appliance and tool sales as a major part of its 3-year turnaround plan. Other initiatives include price-slashing measures and new test stores in the Toronto area. Despite reporting slumping profits, Sears Canada suffers from this same affliction as its U.S. namesake...a soaring stock price. SEARF.PK +34.5% YTD, SHLD +82.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 4 Comments
  • CLS

    Celestica (CLS -1.2%) slips after being downgraded to Hold at Deutsche Bank earlier today on...

    Celestica (CLS -1.2%) slips after being downgraded to Hold at Deutsche Bank earlier today on valuation. Deutsche says the stock is up 23% over the past three months, and has significantly outperformed its peers. Going forward, the firm expects revenue growth to remain in the mid-single digits in FY12 and further operating margin improvements to be more difficult to come by.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • IMOS

    ChipMOS Technologies (IMOS +5.9%) outperforms following a Digitimes column suggesting the...

    ChipMOS Technologies (IMOS +5.9%) outperforms following a Digitimes column suggesting the company will see its Q2 sales rise due to strong smartphone demand, which is boosting sales of the LCD driver chips packaged and tested by ChipMOS, which is now up 178% YTD, previously forecast it would see 10% revenue growth in 2012, following a difficult 2H11.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • TNK

    BofA Merrill Lynch weighs in on Teekay Tankers (TNK +7.5%), upgrading the shares to Neutral...

    BofA Merrill Lynch weighs in on Teekay Tankers (TNK +7.5%), upgrading the shares to Neutral following the shipper's acquisition of 13 vessels from its parent Teekay Corp. (NYSE:TK).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • STJ

    Canaccord is recommending buying St. Jude Medical (STJ +2%) ahead of its upcoming Q1 report. The...

    Canaccord is recommending buying St. Jude Medical (STJ +2%) ahead of its upcoming Q1 report. The firm sees an in-line quarter but feels 2012 guidance is too conservative, saying that with signs of CRM stabilization and new product pipelines, the stocks recent weakness presents a decent buying opportunity for longer-term investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • ZNGA

    Did Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) spook investors with comments from execs published earlier today tipping...

    Did Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) spook investors with comments from execs published earlier today tipping off that the firm is very interested in making acquisitions? Perhaps a fair question with shares of ZNGA -4.1% without any significant news out - while rivals in the sector are enjoying a nice stroll through positive territory.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX +3.4%) gains after Pacific Crest upped the shares to Outperform earlier today,...

    Mellanox (MLNX +3.4%) gains after Pacific Crest upped the shares to Outperform earlier today, saying the shares should benefit from an increase in bandwidth spending over the next year. The firm also boosts its estimates to reflect growing momentum in Web 2.0 and increasing storage and HPC adoption.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • ING

    ING Group (ING +5.5%) is trading higher after BNP Paribas upgraded the shares to Neutral on...

    ING Group (ING +5.5%) is trading higher after BNP Paribas upgraded the shares to Neutral on valuation earlier today. The firm says the company could benefit from asset disposals in the coming months, noting that the stock has underperformed its peers by 30% over the past year and now trades at a 15% discount versus other in its European insurance coverage.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • NRG

    NRG Energy (NRG +5.4%), whose shares have been beaten down in recent months, is upgraded to Buy...

    NRG Energy (NRG +5.4%), whose shares have been beaten down in recent months, is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Deutsche Bank. which sees value in the stock even at a $4 long-term gas price. The firm also raises Genon Energy (GEN +3%) to Hold from Sell, believing shares will be driven largely by RPM results in the near term rather than its challenging fundamental outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC Electronics Materials (WFR +10.9%) rides the coattails of sector rival First Solar higher...

    MEMC Electronics Materials (WFR +10.9%) rides the coattails of sector rival First Solar higher after FSLR decides to dramatically restructure itself. The company - which makes polysilicon wafers and builds solar plants - has outperformed the Market Vectors Solar ETF (NYSEARCA:KWT) by nearly a full percentage point YTD amid the solar stock shakeout.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +6.7%) enjoys a second day of strong gains after Stratasys' merger with...

    3D Systems (DDD +6.7%) enjoys a second day of strong gains after Stratasys' merger with Objet signals that DDD looks well positioned to become a market consolidator in the 3D printing market. Today, DDD announces the acquisition of Paramount Industries for an undisclosed sum, and Maxim raises its target price on DDD shares to $30 from $28.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • KITD

    Shares of KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +6.5%) shoot up after Kaleil Isaza Tuzman resigns as a...

    Shares of KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +6.5%) shoot up after Kaleil Isaza Tuzman resigns as a non-executive chairman. SA author Sankrant Sanu says the move by the charismatic Tuzman marks the end of the beginning for the firm and that now it's now time for KIT Digital to see the rewards of all the entrepreneurial talent it has acquired.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • WHR

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR -5.2%) are getting hit today after the ITC sides with LG in its...

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR -5.2%) are getting hit today after the ITC sides with LG in its antidumping case, saying that unlawfully traded bottom-mount refrigerators imported from South Korea and Mexico did not cause material injury to the U.S. industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • ARNA

    Shares of Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -8.2%) sell off again on above-average volume as a bit of...

    Shares of Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -8.2%) sell off again on above-average volume as a bit of Internet drama stirred up in part by Adam Feuerstein (I, II) continues to interject itself into the ARNA story.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 6 Comments
  • NRG

    GenOn Energy (GEN +2.6%) moves higher after Deutsche upgrades it to Hold on valuation and...

    GenOn Energy (GEN +2.6%) moves higher after Deutsche upgrades it to Hold on valuation and removes the stock from its Short List. The firm notes that lower investor expectations regarding the company's M&A potential appear to be priced into the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +9.7%), down 84% from the start of 2011 as of yesterday's close, is now up...

    First Solar (FSLR +9.7%), down 84% from the start of 2011 as of yesterday's close, is now up strongly on news of its restructuring plan; CEO Mike Ahearn justifies the move by claiming First Solar's Euro ops are "no longer economically sustainable." The announcement was preceded by a downgrade to Neutral from Goldman, which argues collapsing prices for silicon solar panels mean First Solar's thin-film panels are no longer "the clear low-cost leader."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • CIE

    Cobalt International Energy (CIE +5.3%) rebounds after yesterday's report that it could be in...

    Cobalt International Energy (CIE +5.3%) rebounds after yesterday's report that it could be in violation of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act due to activities in Angola. Morgan Stanley says such a violation likely would result in a relatively small fine, and CIE "has no risk of losing its interest in pre-salt Angola blocks under U.S. law."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • NFX

    Jefferies raises its ratings on Newfield Exploration (NFX +5.3%) and Oasis Petroleum (OAS +4.6%)...

    Jefferies raises its ratings on Newfield Exploration (NFX +5.3%) and Oasis Petroleum (OAS +4.6%) to Buy from Hold. Jefferies likes NFX's valuation as well as the chance for production beats this year, and it suspects NFX has been conservative with its flat production guidance for 2012. The firm also recommends OAS, citing its higher long-term forecast for WTI oil prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • IN

    Intermec (IN +8.6%) is raised to Strong Buy from Outperform by Raymond James, which views the...

    Intermec (IN +8.6%) is raised to Strong Buy from Outperform by Raymond James, which views the developer of wired and wireless automated identification and data collection products as well positioned in a consolidating market for rugged mobile computing, and having substantial operating leverage if it can successfully grow its revenue stream.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • BRO

    Brown & Brown (BRO +3.5%) moves up after beating Q1 Street estimates late yesterday. Net...

    Brown & Brown (BRO +3.5%) moves up after beating Q1 Street estimates late yesterday. Net earnings rose 6.8% Y/Y as the firm reported higher commission revenue from its brokerage operations, which largely offset higher investment losses and lower rates on its insurance products.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • TEX

    Terex (TEX +5.9%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Wells Fargo, which expects...

    Terex (TEX +5.9%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Wells Fargo, which expects TEX's backlogs to "expand and earnings to potentially begin to beat over the next few quarters." Despite a 74% YTD gain in the shares and "potential continued short-term rotation away from TEX, we expect the stock will be lifted by improving demand and positive pricing."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • DDMGQ

    Shares of microcap Digital Domain Media Group (DDMG) rip a 13.9% gain after a beyond-the-grave...

    Shares of microcap Digital Domain Media Group (DDMG) rip a 13.9% gain after a beyond-the-grave performance generated by a hologram of rapper Tupac creates a buzz over the technology used to produce the effects. Trading volume on DDMG is already 5X normal daily activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • WST

    West Pharmaceutical (WST +9.8%) shares break out to an eight-month high after the company issues...

    West Pharmaceutical (WST +9.8%) shares break out to an eight-month high after the company issues upside guidance for Q1. WST sees EPS of $0.83, excluding non-recurring items, vs. $0.65 consensus, on revenues of $316M vs. $308M consensus. FY 2012 EPS estimate is raised to $2.50-$2.67 vs. $2.47 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • AN

    Autonation (AN +1.4%) gains on an upgrade to Market Perform on relative valuation at Wells...

    Autonation (AN +1.4%) gains on an upgrade to Market Perform on relative valuation at Wells Fargo, citing a stronger-than-anticipated Q1 sales pace, recent share repurchases and a more positive overall view of the auto retail sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • ACHN

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +5.6%) trades higher with a helping hand from a timely...

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +5.6%) trades higher with a helping hand from a timely initiation from Credit Suisse at Outperform. The company is already on the radar of traders with results from a Phase IIa clinical trial on its Hepatitis C inhibitor ACH-1625 due out this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • SIRI

    A judge throws out a $330M lawsuit vs. Sirius XM (NASDAQ:SIRI) from Howard Stern and his agent...

    A judge throws out a $330M lawsuit vs. Sirius XM (NASDAQ:SIRI) from Howard Stern and his agent for not paying stock awards for helping the firm beat its growth aims. The judge rules that subs from XM Satellite Radio, which Sirius bought in 2008, could not be counted when determining the awards. Sirius is +3.5% but what does this mean for Stern's future?
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 5 Comments
  • CMA

    Comerica (CMA +3.2%) trades higher after easily beating Q1 estimates. Net earnings rose 26% Y/Y,...

    Comerica (CMA +3.2%) trades higher after easily beating Q1 estimates. Net earnings rose 26% Y/Y, boosted by an 8% jump in loan growth and a sharp decrease in loan-loss provisions. Net-charge offs were at the lowest level since Q307, falling to 43% of average loans from 103% a year earlier and 57% in the prior quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • KBR

    KBR (KBR +4.2%) trades higher after JPMorgan initiates coverage on the company with an...

    KBR (KBR +4.2%) trades higher after JPMorgan initiates coverage on the company with an Overweight rating and $45 price target on a valuation call.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • BB

    After spiking near yesterday's close on a report it's looking to hire strategic advisers,...

    After spiking near yesterday's close on a report it's looking to hire strategic advisers, Research In Motion (RIMM -1.6%) is underperforming in early trading. Though the report claims RIM is willing to license its OS to third parties (interest might be limited given the alternatives), and explore options for monetizing its messaging software and patents ([[MSFT is said to be interested in the patents), it's added RIM "doesn't plan to sell itself." (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • KO

    Bank of America weighs in on Coca-Cola's (KO +1.9%) Q1 earnings report (I, II), noting that the...

    Bank of America weighs in on Coca-Cola's (KO +1.9%) Q1 earnings report (I, II), noting that the earnings beat was partially generated by better-than-expected results out of Northwest Europe and the Nordics. Shares of KO are changing hands at $73.89 - closing in on BofA's price target of $75.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • PBTH

    Prolor Biotech (PBTH +4.9%) reports positive pre-clinical results from an animal study for its...

    Prolor Biotech (PBTH +4.9%) reports positive pre-clinical results from an animal study for its obesity and Type II diabetes drug candidate MOD-6030. When administered once a week over 30 days, PBTH says the treatment produced an average weight loss of 28% and a 19% reduction in blood glucose levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +9%) pops after the FDA grants it clearance to start a Phase II...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +9%) pops after the FDA grants it clearance to start a Phase II clinical trials for PLX-PAD, its cell product candidate for the treatment of a subset of peripheral artery disease called Intermittent Claudication.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 2 Comments
  • USB

    U.S. Bancorp (USB +1%) and Comerica (CMA +5.2%) each posted Q1 earnings gains of more than 25%...

    U.S. Bancorp (USB +1%) and Comerica (CMA +5.2%) each posted Q1 earnings gains of more than 25% (I, II), thanks to increased lending and lower credit costs and loan-loss provisions, offering a bullish take on the economy and reinforcing the notion that smaller, regional banks are recovering more strongly from the financial crisis than the giants.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 5 Comments
  • CPST

    Shares of Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST) roar to a 6.5% gain premarket after the firm announces...

    Shares of Capstone Turbine (NASDAQ:CPST) roar to a 6.5% gain premarket after the firm announces that it received an order for 30 more microturbines from oil and gas players in the Eagle Ford Shale region. The firm's CEO says oil & gas sales now account for 60% of revenue through the first 3 quarters of FY12.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Heavyweight earnings results and a better mood from Europe are helping push U.S....

    Market preview: Heavyweight earnings results and a better mood from Europe are helping push U.S. stock futures up, with the S&P Benchmark +0.75%. That's despite the weakest housing starts in 5 months. Coca Cola, J&J and Goldman Sachs are moderately higher following results, while First Solar (+4.4%) shines brightly on a restructuring. Later: Intel, IBM and Yahoo earnings
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ACCO

    ACCO Brands (ABD) -6.6% premarket after issuing downward guidance for Q1, seeing EPS of...

    ACCO Brands (ABD) -6.6% premarket after issuing downward guidance for Q1, seeing EPS of -$0.05, excluding non-recurring items, vs. $0.02 consensus, and revenues of $288.9M vs. $299.6M consensus. The company says sales were up in all major geographies except Europe and Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • PESI

    Perma-Fix Environmental Systems (NASDAQ:PESI) +17.6% premarket on news that the company is part...

    Perma-Fix Environmental Systems (NASDAQ:PESI) +17.6% premarket on news that the company is part of a team awarded two major clean-up agreements at Los Alamos National Laboratory.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 1 Comment
